intro: Sphaeralcea elata, commonly known as the desert globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its globular shape, with numerous small, yellow flowers clustered at the top of its stems. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or rocky soils. Sphaeralcea elata is drought-tolerant and has adapted to survive in harsh desert conditions.
